fields.description: It seems like the error response including HTTP return code and message isn't really formatted according to what EC2 specifies ([http://docs.amazonwebservic es.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/](http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/l atest/APIReference/)). I'm not sure if we should carry the stack trace in the response. fields.summary: Make sure error codes are compatible with EC2

comments.body: Originally posted on 2011-11-04 19:06:11 by sang-min.park@eucalyptus.com Fri Nov 04 12:06:09 2011: Request 4398 was acted upon. Transaction: Ticket created by sang-min.park Queue: Engineering Bugs Subject: Make sure error codes are compatible with EC2 Owner: Nobody Requestors: sang-min.park@eucalyptus.com Status: new Ticket It seems like the error response including HTTP return code and message isn't really formatted according to what EC2 specifies (http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/). I'm not sure if we should carry the stack trace in the response.
